IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Inglis Foundation is the "parent" organization that provides strategic planning, fundraising, and public relations for "Inglis," a group of entities providing services to people with physical disabilities in the Philadelphia, PA, area.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The Inglis Foundation's mission is to enable people with disabilities, and to those who care for them, to achieve their goals and live life to the fullest. Inglis partners with the disability community to provide practical solutions that enable consumers to overcome barriers and to live life with the greatest possible independence and mobility.
IRS990.Description: The Inglis organization grew out of the work of Inglis House, a public charity founded in 1877, to provide long-term, rehabilitative medical and nursing care designed to maximize the independence for 297 residents with physical disabilities. During fiscal year 2010, Inglis Foundation served the evolving needs of over 2,000 people with severe disabilities through Inglis House and Inglis' community-based services for people with physical disabilities living independently in the community. These programs include:1. Care Management- Worked with a monthly average of 115 clients (1,385 client months of service) to help them arrange and manage the resources necessary to maintain a healthy, independent lifestyle.2. Community Employment Services- worked with 54 individuals with physical and mental disabilities, providing 1,273 job coaching and training hours to help them to achieve employment with local businesses.3. Drink Aide- Sold 1,463 water bottles specially designed and patented for individuals with physical disabilities that allows the individual to drink without the assistance of another individual.4. Inglis Foundation is the "parent" organization of Inglis House, which provided nursing care to persons with physical disabilities through the operation of a 297 bed skilled nursing facility.5. Inglis Foundation is the "parent" organization of Inglis House, which administers the Adult Day Program which provided social, educational, therapeutic, and wellness activities for a daily average participant census of 28 individuals (7,223 participant days) of all ages who live independently. 6. Inglis Foundation is the "parent" organization of the Inglis Housing Corporation which owns and operates 160 units of accessible and affordable rental housing available to low income persons with physical disabilities.

Inglis follows the provisions of the income tax standard regarding the recognition and measurement of uncertain tax positions. The application of these provisions has no impact on the Organization's financial statements. Inglis' income tax returns are subject to review and examination by federal, state, and local authorities. Inglis is not aware of any activities that would jeopardize its tax-exempt status. Inglis is not aware of any activities that are subject to tax on unrelated business income or excise or other taxes. The tax returns for the years 2007 to 2009 are open to examination by federal, local, and state authorities.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Recipients submit a one page written report on how they will use the funds.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Part I, Line 4a: The following severance payments were made during fiscal year 2010: Stephanie Maguire - $120,688 Veronica Hill-Milbourne - $139,190 Mario Porro - $52,492

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The prepared 990 was reviewed by the Audit and Compliance Committee and provided to each member of the board of directors prior to being filed with the IRS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: All employees of Inglis Foundation and related entities must ensure that customer care and business activities are conducted in an objective manner and are not motivated by desire for personal or financial gain. All employees are required to disclose any actual or potential conflict of interest to his or her manager, human resources or the Chief Ethics and Compliance Officer for appropriate determination and resolution. In addition, all directors, officers, members of Committees with board-delegated powers and all senior managers must complete a Conflict of Interest Affirmation of Compliance and Disclosure Statement upon hiring, on an annual basis, and when a potential conflict of interest arises. The Foundation's Committee on the Board has responsibility for reviewing the disclosure statements and enforcing the policy.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: An independent firm presents findings to the Board of Trustees for approval of compensation package for CEO and senior management team.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization makes the governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public upon request.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Oversight Committee of the audit and Financial Statements:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Organization has a committee that oversees the audit of its financial statements as well as the selection of an independent auditor. This has not changed since prior year.
